Description: Glazed composition cylinder seal inscribed with four serekhs of king Pepy I and titles of an official.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: The name of the owner of this seal is unknown, but the titles in the columns between the serekhs identify him as a priest of the lion god Rrw, a supervisor of artistic works, and an official in the judiciary system. Bibliography: Regulski, I. (ed.), 2022. Hieroglyphs: unlocking ancient Egypt, pp. 86-7.
Bibliographic references: Zitman 2010 / The necropolis of Assiut: a case study of local Egyptian funerary culture from the Old Kingdom to the end of the Middle Kingdom (I, 73, 81; II, 233)
Goedicke 1961 / Die Siegelzylinder von Pepi I (73-74)
Exhibition history: 2022-2023 13 Oct-19 Feb, London, BM, Hieroglyphs: unlocking ancient Egypt
